page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY 1965
page.content: Rationing had ended.Welfare state came into being.There was{full employment Many decided not to return to the village.Everything became{mechanized} Farmers had cars and tractors. There were better machines for grass cutting hay making and baling necessitating a smaller work force.Derelict farms were bought,rebuilt with grants and sold at a profit.Factory farming of pigs and poultry were in evidence.{Electricity {and the telephone}had reached most farms.Public water supply was available near the road sides.Property was {modernized}with inside toilets and bathrooms.Public water supply was available.Household appliances were run by electricity.Gas was still important. Bread and confectionery was bought in the local shop.Private cars were more popular.{Black and White {Television}Chapel,w/men's club closed.
